intro: Coccoloba schwackeana, commonly known as the scarlet coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive, palm-like appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is also valued for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and partial shade.
